page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY 4
page.content: A few years ago, road resurfacing reached the bridge at Plucks Gutter. A platoon of Army Cadets with their officer asked permission to lay a{mock {demoliton charge}as an exercise. While making an artistic arrangement of wires and modelling clay, they found a real charge! This (50lbs of Gun Cotton) had been installed in the dark days of 1940 by the Army or Home Guard, and all record lost.{Bomb {Disposal Experts}were about to blow up the charge in a nearby field when it was pointed outthat they had placed the explosives over the{main gaspipe {to}Thanet. After this, a search was made of all the bridges in East Kent. Other{charges}were found, relics of the time when a German invasion was expected at any moment and men stood to arms in every field.
